description: From Middle English aknowen, from Old English ācnāwan, oncnāwan (“to know, recognize”), equivalent to a- +‎ know.

verbs.description: acknow (third-person singular simple present acknows, present participle acknowing, simple past acknew, past participle acknown)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To acknowledge; confess (often with "of" or "on"), reveal, disclose, realize
